resource.chars:
[Having thus briefly indicated the way in which 
the effect now treated of originates, I will now 
proceed with the analytical investigation of 
<s>their<\s> its amount.
In the present communication, however, I shall 
confine my attention to the principal terms of the 
change thus produced in the acceleration of the moon’s 
motion, deferring to another, though I hope, not a 
distant opportunity, the fuller development of this,
as well as the treatment of the secular variations of the other elements 
of the moon’s <s>motion<\s> orbit, which arising from the same 
cause, have also been hitherto overlooked.
In what follows, the notation, except where 
otherwise explained, is the same as that of 
Damoiseau’s “Theorie de la Lune”.]
If we suppose the moon to move in the plane of 
the Ecliptic, & also neglect the terms depending on 
the Sun’s Parallax, the differential equations of the 
moon’s motion <s>are<\s> become
